definition: non-Han tribes in the east and north of ancient China/barbarians
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty

Five non-Han people, namely: Huns or Xiongnu 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2], Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑[Xian1 bei1], Jie 羯[Jie2], Di 氐[Di1], Qiang 羌[Qiang1], esp. in connection with the Sixteen Kingdoms 304-439 五胡十六國|五胡十六国[Wu3 hu2 Shi2 liu4 guo2]
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
Jie people, a tribe of northern China around the 4th century
